text: walking along the busy streets of Saigon
sometimes you run into these pop-up
stores right on the street site selling
some traditional Vietnamese sweet treats
the setup is very simple with a carrying
pole with a burning Chekhov stove on one
end and a tray displaying the final
products on the other the seller makes
the case right there when you order this
one is selling a kind of thing and
crispy waffle and some sort of
Vietnamese mini cupcake
there's another snack that I remember
eating and loving Lots scenes a child
but it's getting harder and harder to
fight these days caught one new is a
kind of crispy cookies in a flower shape
so today I will make it at home let's
begin the ingredients you're going to
need 75 gram of uh purpose flour 50 gram
of rice flour 1 egg 2 ml of coconut milk
and 50 gram of sugar firstly you want to
come by the all-purpose flour and the
rice flour in a large mixing bowl then
dissolve the sugar in the coconut milk
with a pinch of salt make a hole in the
center and pour in the coconut milk
mixture also crack in one egg and stir
well until you get a smooth batter now
let the batter rest for about 15 to 30
minutes if you want to color the cookies
divide the butter into three small balls
for the green color mix one bowl with a
few drops of panning extract now the red
color you can mix with a few drops of
red food colorings and using some
homemade red food coloring made from red
beets the third bowl you can leave it
playing today I'm using two flower moles
about 6 centimeter in diameter you can
buy these at the Vietnamese markets or
online and we put the links below where
you can get them eat a lot of vegetable
oil in the pan at least 2 inches high
until you stand a chopstick in the
center and see bubbles appear out it
when the oil is hot enough then you turn
the heat to very low and start frying
you want to submerge the moulds into the
hot oil first to prevent sticking and
also to warm it up then lift up and
gently shake off the excess oil quickly
dip the molds into the butter you just
want to dip about two-thirds of the mold
into the butter because if you submerge
the mold completely into the butter it's
going to be very difficult to remove the
cakes from the more later you will get a
really thin layer of the butter sticking
on the bowl then quickly dip the mold
into the hot oil up to a few seconds the
case gonna drop off the mold and there
you have a really pretty flower cookie
fry until both sides are golden brown
and place them on a paper towel to bring
off the excess oil making these cookies
are really so much fun if the most you
using our brand new is could be sticky
for the first one but after a few tries
you're gonna get the hands of it the
cookies look very soft in the hot oil
but when you let the corn out completely
it will become very crispy they taste
the best freshly fried you can sprinkle
some powdered sugar or cinnamon sugar on
top or you can also serve it with some
ice cream or drizzles up some chocolate
sauce you can also store them in a
airtight plastic container or a plastic
bag and keep them for several days now
listen to this mmm very crispy I hope
you like this video and don't forget to
click like and subscribe to my channel
for more delicious Vietnamese foods and
Asian cakes thank you for watching bye
bye
